msContents.summary: Letter of Artemidoros to Zenon about a grain shipment delivered by Demetrios, Demostratos, Amyntas and Theodoros; by mistake he paid freight charges upon the whole load, even though some barley belonged to the owners of the boat

msItem.note: Almost complete: the very beginnings of the lines are missing; written across the fibers with 6 lines
On the back, along the fibers, address and docket: received May 5, 257 BC

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in July 1925; no. 78 in Bell's inventory

keywords.term: 4 men mentioned, -- Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, Prosopography pp. 274-457.

div.ab: Artemidoros to Zenon, greetings. There have been measured out to me from Demetrios and Demostratos 3190 artabs of wheat and from Amyntas and Theudoros 210 artabs--I have paid the transport charges for the entire lading because (Amynthas and Theudoros) did not tell me on board that what belongs to them is included in the total amount--and 872 1/2 artabs of barley. Good-by . Year 28, Dystros 23. [Verso:] Artemidoros concerning the grain, that it has been measured out from Demostratos and Demetrios. To Zenon. Year 29, Xandikos 2.
